title: Quarkus doesn't support 2.2.5.Final apicurio-registry-mem anymore and documentation should provide compatibility info
body:
### Describe the bug

After https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/32527 `apicurio-registry-mem:2.2.5.Final` can't be used anymore with Quarkus. Documentation provides information on compatibility that confuses me - it speaks bout `2.1.5.Final` instead of `2.4.2.Final` and I'm not sure what is actual version of `apicurio-registry-mem` that can be used with Quarkus now. 

@ozangunalp promised he will look into this and I'm opening this issue for reference (also so that we don't forget about it).

### Expected behavior

- there is specifically stated version of supported apicurio-registry-mem
- docs is updated as combining `2.1.5.Final` with `2.4.2.Final` is IMO lefover
- (optional) this is breaking change, include it to the migration guide

### Actual behavior

I hit serialization issues when using 2.2.5.Final as previously:

```
Cannot deserialize value of type java.util.Date from String "2023-04-14T02:15:27+0000": expected format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'
```

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer:

run https://github.com/quarkus-qe/quarkus-test-framework/blob/main/examples/kafka-registry/src/test/java/io/quarkus/qe/StrimziKafkaWithRegistryMessagingIT.java with `-Dquarkus.platform.version=999-SNAPSHOT` and head on 5a4b1cf948b69843d82d64e152a38ec72c0c1640

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

_No response_
